definition: (of a watercourse) to breach its banks/(of a dam) to burst
to decide/to determine/to execute (sb)/(of a dam etc) to breach or burst/definitely/certainly
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: Flood waters poured through a gap in the embankment of the swollen jumna river.
sentences.chinese: 亚穆纳河涨水，洪水从河堤的一道决口冲了出来。

sentences.english: If dam breaks, a flash flood could threaten downstream villages. (AP Photo/Shabbir Ahmed Mir)
sentences.chinese: 如果大坝决口，暴涨和洪水可能威胁到下游的村民。

sentences.english: A dam burst and flooded their villages.
sentences.chinese: 堤坝决口，淹没了他们的村庄。

sentences.english: No matter what happens, I will never lose heart.
sentences.chinese: 不管发生什么，人将决不得到决口。

sentences.english: Flood waters poured through a gap in the embankment of the swollen Jumna River.
sentences.chinese: 洪水从河堤的一道决口冲了出来。

sentences.english: The grain size of the sediment in distributary mouth bar is coarser than that in the crevasse splay sediment.
sentences.chinese: 三角洲前缘河口砂坝沉积物粒度较平原决口扇粗。

sentences.english: We got the news that the dam burst.
sentences.chinese: 我们得到到消息说大坝决口了。

definition: to pilot a ship/to channel water/to draw water (for irrigation)
